snippet: President Obama told an audience of technology enthusiasts he supported efforts to gain protected information from electronic devices, opposing the stance taken by Apple.
abstract: President Obama, addressing audience at South by Southwest festival and media conference, reinforces his stand against data encryption policies embraced by technology companies like Apple; holds information on electronic devices should be available to law enforcement agencies, in stance that is significant break with Silicon Valley community that has supported him in his political career.
lead_paragraph: President Obama told an audience of technology enthusiasts he supported efforts to gain protected information from electronic devices, opposing the stance taken by Apple.

headline.main: Obama, at South by Southwest, Calls for Law Enforcement Access in Encryption Fight
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls for Law Enforcement Access in Encryption Fight

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: South by Southwest Music and Media Conference
